Module Frogger
Package p4_group_8_repo.Views

Class GameScreenView

java.lang.Object
p4_group_8_repo.Views.GameScreenView
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameViews
public class GameScreenView
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameViews
This class is responsible for displaying the game screen view on which the user play the game.
It is responsible for the look of the different levels of the game such as what actors should be added to each level and the difficulty of the levels.
There are 5 different levels in the game and the user can select whichever level they want to try.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Actor animal
    the main playable actor in the game
    private World background
    The World that currently has all the game's actors in it
    private java.lang.String imageSource
    A string to hold the file path of the image source.
    private int level
    the level of the game

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScreenView

      public GameScreenView​(int level, Actor animal, World background)
      Constructor that instantiates a new Game screen. Sets the level, the main actor and the world.
      Parameters:
      level - the level of the game
      animal - main actor of the game playable by the user
      background - the world of the game in which the actors exist

  • Method Details

    • view

      public javafx.scene.Scene view​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Displays the game screen and calls the start method of the stage so the animation can start.
      Specified by:
      view in interface GameViews
      Parameters:
      stage - the stage of the game application.
      Returns:
      Scene object that will display the game screen

    • levels

      private void levels()
      Sets the background of the stage, and adds Actor objects to it according to the level selected.

    • createBackButton

      private void createBackButton​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Creates a back button that allows the user to go back to the levels menu from the game screen.
      Parameters:
      stage - stage of the application

    • createMusicButton

      private void createMusicButton()
      Creates a music button on the screen that allows the user to turn the music on/off.

    • addObstacle

      private void addObstacle​(int speed, boolean secondCar)
      Adds Obstacle objects to the game.
      Parameters:
      speed - the speed of the obstacles
      secondCar - if a second car is needed on the level

    • addActorsToStage

      private void addActorsToStage​(int logY, int turtleY, int wetTurtleY, int endY, int log3Y, int log2Y, boolean croc)
      Adds Actor objects such as Logs or Turtles to the stage as well as the main Animal object that the user plays with.
      Parameters:
      logY - the log object's Y position
      turtleY - the turtle object's Y position
      wetTurtleY - the wet turtle object's Y position
      endY - the end goal object's Y position
      log3Y - the log (type 3) object's Y position
      log2Y - the log (type 2) object's Y position
      croc - if a red crocodile object should be added to the stage

    • waterLevels

      private void waterLevels​(int logSpeed, boolean car)
      Adds Actor objects to levels that are water based i.e levels that are mainly on a river as compared to other levels.
      Parameters:
      logSpeed - speed of Log objects
      car - boolean as to whether to add an Obstacle object, car, or not
